intro: Hoffmannseggella rodriguesii, commonly known as the Rodrigues hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat.
